Comment: As a - very ancedotal - data point, I recently talked to a Latin American friend who has been living in China for the past 10 years or so. I asked him how the Chinese public is reacting to the tariff war.  His answer? They aren't.  They are confident that their government has done enough amassing of resources and planning to weather this storm, so for the most part people just don't care about it. People on the street don't care. The government isn't panicking about it. The media - of course - follows the government lead. Everyone agrees that China as a country and culture will survive this without a problem and they aren't scared of a recession.  So there's literally *no reason* for China to let deescalate, unless Trump blinks and makes the first move in that direction. The 'Deal Maker' has really painted himself into a very stupid corner.
